name: How and Where to Access Legacy ECB Archives
author: HipRedux

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I figured it appropriate to place the two links together away from the main activity for safe-keeping.  These are the respective locations of The Krit's archive of both the Epic and Pre-epic Character Build submissions from the now-defunct Bioware Guild and Registry:

Epic Character Builds

Pre-epic Character Builds

In both cases, decompressing the associated zip will create 3 folders.  By navigating to the applicable search html in the buildsearch folder and opening it in a browser with javascript enabled, the familiar search screen will appear matching the server-side utility (currently unhosted).  Filenames: Epic - ECB_search.html, Pre-epic - PECB_search.html    

There are also some other interesting html lists you may want to access within the builds folder that contain links to general discussions and guides. You will notice that the data (or data0) subfolder contains all the individual topics in html (the main data storage folder) but the files in the builds section contain the list of topics as an index making it easy to navigate.

Final Note:  Until the search utility has been rehosted, I suggest that if builders would like to reference one of the legacy builds they simply furnish enough of a description that would make it easy for any member to find using their local copy of the archive search.  Towards that end... please supply the build's title, class split and author.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
I was able to get the search page to work, but I had to open it in Firefox.

Both Safari and Chrome failed to work correctly with the search engine form.

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
Usually I use IE for this, although I didn't try it with FF.
Yep, it does not work with chrome, and iirc with opera neither, but I will check it when I get back home.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: You may try at Greyhawk

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content: +1 On Greyhawk. For some mysterious reason the local ECB archive on my computer just stopped working a few days ago - it just says "Archive not found" or similar, both with FF and Chrome. I tried (lazily) to fix it, but Greyhawk works just as well, so now I just use that. Also easier to link builds that way.

Apparently it was a problem with many Tapatalk sites around the globe. Their admin folk assure us all is fine again, but please let me know if it persists, becuase they've been known to tell porkies.

Cheers

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
Just tested: No database found.

Very dramatic!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Hmm. I just clicked on Hip's link and it took me straight to the Vault. Reading through the comments section, it appears several people had the same issue, and it was solved by activating javascript - someone also posted a workaround solution if there are problems with Chrome, as Firefox should use javascript already. Can you get to the Vault alright?

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content: Yep, no problem. Just uploaded a project, actually!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Okay, I've done some more fumbling around and, essentially Mick's link to the Greyhawk site above is the only one that actually takes you to the relevant Legacy Build Archives - other than Empyre's link in another thread here, but that's the same one, it transpires. Hip's lead post was back in 2015, before the Greyhawk site became available elsewhere, and was meant as a stop-gap. It's now defunkt, unless you'd already downloaded it, which I had, and it still works, so I missed the change when tidying things up. Sorry DPA, and anyone else who's been struggling of late.

Marvellous - more housekeeping!
